intro: Silvia curialis, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellow or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, silvery fuzz, adding to its ornamental appeal. Silvia curialis is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant colors and drought-resistant properties.
